enWisdom: Poverty is the adornment of faith

Wisdom: الْفَقِيرُ الرَّاضِي نَاجٍ مِنْ حَبَائِلِ إِبْلِيسَ وَالْغَنِيُّ وَاقِعٌ فِي حَبَائِلِهِ
enWisdom: The pauper who is satisfied is saved from the traps of Satan, whereas the rich person falls into his snares

Wisdom: الْفَقْرُ صَلَاحُ الْمُؤْمِنِ وَمُرِيحُهُ مِنْ حَسَدِ الْجِيرَانِ وَتَمَلُّقِ الْإِخْوَانِ وَتَسَلُّطِ السُّلْطَانِ
enWisdom: Poverty is beneficial for the believer, and gives him comfort from the jealousy of the neighbours, the flattery of the brothers and the domination of the ruler
Many a poor person is mightier than a lion

Wisdom: ضَرَرُ الْفَقْرِ أَحْمَدُ مِنْ أَشَرِ الْغِنَى
enWisdom: The disadvantage of poverty is more praiseworthy than the arrogant insolence of wealth
The vocation [one undertakes] is based on the extent of deprivation

Wisdom: فِي خِفَّةِ الظَّهْرِ رَاحَةُ السِّرِّ وَتَحْصِينُ الْقَدْرِ
enWisdom: In having a light burden there is inner peace and the safeguarding of [one’s] status

Wisdom: مَنْ أَحَبَّ السَّلَامَةَ فَلْيُؤْثِرِ الْفَقْرَ وَمَنْ أَحَبَّ الرَّاحَةَ فَلْيُؤْثِرِ الزُّهْدَ فِي الدُّنْيَا
enWisdom: One who loves security must prefer poverty [over wealth] and one who loves comfort must prefer abstinence from pleasures in this world

Wisdom: مَنْ سَلَا عَنْ مَوَاهِبِ الدُّنْيَا عَزَّ
enWisdom: One who does not think about the bounties of his world becomes powerful

Wisdom: مَا أَحْسَنَ تَوَاضُعَ الْأَغْنِيَاءِ لِلْفُقَرَاءِ طَلَباً لِمَا عِنْدَ اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ وَمَا أَحْسَنَ تِيهَ الْفُقَرَاءِ عَلَى الْأَغْنِيَاءِ اتِّكَالًا عَلَى اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ
enWisdom: How good is the humility shown by the wealthy towards the poor in order to attain that which is with Allah, the Glorified, and how good is the pride of the poor in front of the wealthy out of [their] trust in Allah, the Glorified!
The kings of this world and the Hereafter are the poor who are satisfied [with what they have]
